intro: Senecio tsimihety, commonly known as the Madagascar groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, narrow leaves. It produces yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, and it is adapted to the unique environmental conditions of its native region. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
